perturbation.original_text:
6.1 Payment Terms. JRVS shall submit an invoice to the Distributor upon shipment of Products to the Distributor. The
invoice shall state the amount to be paid by the Distributor for all Products in such shipment, as well as any taxes, duties or
excises paid by JRVS which shall be reimbursed by the Distributor in accordance with Section 5.4. Terms of payment shall be net
thirty (30) days. All payments shall be in U.S. Dollars.
perturbation.changed_text:
6.1 Payment Terms. JRVS shall submit an invoice to the Distributor upon shipment of Products to the Distributor. The
invoice shall state the amount to be paid by the Distributor for all Products in such shipment, as well as any taxes, duties or
excises paid by JRVS which shall be reimbursed by the Distributor in accordance with Section 5.4. Terms of payment shall be net
thirty (30) days. However, for the first six months of this agreement, the payment term will be net fifteen (15) days. All payments shall be in U.S. Dollars.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction by stating that the payment terms are net 30 days generally, but specifies a net 15-day payment term for the initial six months. This creates ambiguity as to which payment term applies and when.

perturbation.original_text:
6.2 Late Payments. All amounts which are not timely paid by the Distributor as required by this Agreement shall be subject
to a late charge equal to one and one-half percent (1.5%) per month (or, if less, the maximum allowed by applicable law). In the
event that any payment due hereunder is overdue, JRVS reserves the right to suspend performance until such delinquency is
corrected.
perturbation.changed_text:
6.2 Late Payments. All amounts which are not timely paid by the Distributor as required by this Agreement shall be subject
to a late charge equal to one and one-half percent (1.5%) per month (or, if less, the maximum allowed by applicable law). However, no late charges will be applied during the first year of this agreement. In the
event that any payment due hereunder is overdue, JRVS reserves the right to suspend performance until such delinquency is
corrected.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction by stating that there will be late charge equal to 1.5% per month for late payment, but specifies no late charges will be applied during the first year of this agreement. This creates ambiguity as to which late payment policy applies and when.

perturbation.original_text:
12.2 Termination for Convenience. This Agreement may be terminated by either party for any reason or no reason, whether
or not extended beyond the initial term, by giving the other party written notice ninety (90) days in advance.
perturbation.changed_text:
12.2 Termination for Convenience. This Agreement may be terminated by either party for any reason or no reason, whether
or not extended beyond the initial term, by giving the other party written notice ninety (90) days in advance. However, JRVS can terminate this agreement with a 30-day notice.
perturbation.explanation: This introduces a direct contradiction by stating both parties can terminate with 90 days' notice, but then specifies JRVS can terminate with 30 days' notice. This creates uncertainty about the required notice period for JRVS.
